2212-65.field_pool_questionname: List any ways you will change your treatment of COPD patients as a result of attending this program
answer: I will be much more pro-active in evaluating inhaler technique when patients present for refills.
ensure technique is reviewed at refills as well
Discuss device technique at every interactions. Assess whether patient will benefit from SMI
Communicate with physicians to optimize therapy by switching my Spiriva patients to Spiriva respimat
The presenter was a motivator to how we as pharmacists can play a pivotal role to these patients to ensure they are using their inhaler appropriately.
I also plan on adding this when people have exacerbations in order to figure out how the exacerbation may have been triggered (i.e.: improper use of the inhalers)
Review technique more when refills, Also, will train and review presentation with co-worker (write newsletter or post on website)
Evaluate the options for devices based on their needs.
make time to assess inhaler technique
More counselling technique with refills and be sure patients are clear with use. Changing or making a recommendation to change if their inspiratory force is not adequate for DPI.
Ensuring dementia patients have appropriate device (I work in residential care)
I will be recommending the use of SMI s more frequently
I will encourage increased time spent with these patients to ensure proper use of the devices.

I will show patients proper techniques in using inhalers and for repeat Rxs will try to review with them proper use of inhalers. I will discuss with doctors new treatment options available for COPD including soft mist inhalers
To review device use and look for opportunity to find the correct fit of device type
ask patients to show how they use the device. Make changes to the type of device to fit their lifestyle
I will attempt to review patients inhaler use and techniques and have the confidence to counsel and recommend the newer inhaler devices.
Knowing more of the combination inhaled medication options available, I can help reduce the use of various devices for patients who use multiple individual devices.
reminding the pharmacy team to work together to assess patients and ask more patients to review how they are using their inhalers
have patients sit in a private area and make pts more comfortable to discuss questions regarding COPD management and review their devices
more comfortable asking patients `would you show me how this device is working for you
e more proactive, making more recommendations to MDs re: alternate inhalers to address dexterity issues, reduced inspiratory flow, ease of use --  ultimately, to improve patient outcomes

I plan on implementing the guidelines into my professional practice by asking long term inhaler users to demonstrate their inhaler technique at follow up appointments in order to better optimize their therapy
examples that presenter gave as to how to start the conversation about showing inhaler technique.
make of point of reviewing inhaler technique even when repeat Rxs; open the discussion with patients on inhaler use/technique/adherence
